original: shes pa mtha' yas pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag mngon par rtogs pa gang gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: shes pa mtha' yas pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag mngon par rtogs pa gang gis bsdus she na /
translated: Are the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight subsumed within any of the realizations?

original: smras pa / gang gis kyang ma bsdus te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gis kyang ma bsdus te /
translated: He says: They are not subsumed within any of them.

original: de dag kyang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de dad pa mngon par rtogs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o // bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de dad pa mngon par rtogs pa yang yin la /
translated: However, they should be understood as being the natural outcome of the realizations.🔽Is every realization of the mental disposition also a realization of faith?

original: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de yang bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa yin nam zhen /
analyzed: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa de yang bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa yin nam zhen /
translated: Or, is every realization of faith also a realization of the mental disposition?

original: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /🔽de la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa yin la dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ma yin pa ni dkon mchog la dmigs pa'i nges par sems pa ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / mu bzhi ste / de la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa yin la dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ma yin pa ni dkon mchog la dmigs pa'i nges par sems pa ma gtogs pa /
translated: He says: There are four possibilities.🔽In this regard, there is a realization of the mental disposition that is not a realization of faith.

original: de las gzhan pa la dmigs pa'i nges par sems pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la dmigs pa'i nges par sems pa'o //
translated: This refers to the ascertainment of the mental disposition that is focused on something other than the Jewels.

original: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa yin la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ma yin pa ni dkon mchog la dmigs pa dad pa thos pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa yin la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ma yin pa ni dkon mchog la dmigs pa dad pa thos pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba gang yin pa'o /
translated: Faith is the realization of faith, but not the realization of reflection, which is faith that arises from hearing and reflection with regard to the Three Jewels.

original: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa yang yin la dad pa mngon par rtogs pa yang yin pa ni dkon mchog la dmigs pa'i nges par sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa yang yin la dad pa mngon par rtogs pa yang yin pa ni dkon mchog la dmigs pa'i nges par sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Both the realization of faith and the realization of reflection is the ascertainment that arises from meditation with regard to the Three Jewels.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The other possibilities are the four possibilities that are not included in those.

original: tshul de nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i mu bzhi dag kyang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul de nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i mu bzhi dag kyang rig par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the other four possibilities should be understood.

original: nyan thos kyis las brtsams nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the sravaka,

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i lam la gcig pu spyod pa dang / tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba dang / tshig 'og ma dang sbyor @280b ba dang ; mu bzhi'i tshul ni dpag tu med pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i lam la gcig pu spyod pa dang / tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba dang / tshig 'og ma dang sbyor @280b ba dang ; mu bzhi'i tshul ni dpag tu med pa rig par bya'o //
translated: the four possibilities of the path of ascertainment should be understood: the one who practices alone, the one who applies the former words, the one who applies the latter words, and the one who applies the four possibilities.

original: ser sna dang dri ma de dag nyis ka la ser sna'i dri ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ser sna dang dri ma de dag nyis ka la ser sna'i dri ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Both stinginess and stain are called the stain of stinginess.

original: dri ma ni brgyad de /
analyzed: dri ma ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight stains.

original: de dag gis dri ma can du gyur pa'i sems kyi rgyud ni ser sna'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gis dri ma can du gyur pa'i sems kyi rgyud ni ser sna'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa yin pas /
translated: A mindstream that is stained by them is the basis for the state of miserliness.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni ser sna'i dri ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni ser sna'i dri ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called the stains of miserliness.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: sngon sbyin pa la ma goms pas tshe 'di la zang zing la gdu ba nyid dang / lus dang srog la shas cher lta zhing 'jig rten pha rol la mi lta ba nyid dang / gang zag ser sna can rnams dang lhan cig 'grogs shing de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sngon sbyin pa la ma goms pas tshe 'di la zang zing la gdu ba nyid dang / lus dang srog la shas cher lta zhing 'jig rten pha rol la mi lta ba nyid dang / gang zag ser sna can rnams dang lhan cig 'grogs shing de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang /
translated: Not being accustomed to generosity in the past, one is attached to material things in this life, one greatly values one’s body and life and does not value the next world, one associates with and follows miserly individuals,

original: zhing mi mthun par lta zhing zhing yongs su tshol ba nyid dang / sngon snying rje la ma goms shing de la phan yon du lta ba nyid dang / tshogs chen pos longs spyod bsgrubs shing de la yongs su goms pa'i 'du shes kyis le lo dang snyom las byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: zhing mi mthun par lta zhing zhing yongs su tshol ba nyid dang / sngon snying rje la ma goms shing de la phan yon du lta ba nyid dang / tshogs chen pos longs spyod bsgrubs shing de la yongs su goms pa'i 'du shes kyis le lo dang snyom las byed pa nyid dang /
translated: one views fields of generosity as not being suitable, one seeks out fields of generosity, one is not accustomed to compassion in the past and views it as being of no benefit, one is lazy and indolent due to the idea that one has accomplished enjoyments through great accumulation and is accustomed to them,🔽and one is not accustomed to the idea of impermanence.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin zhing gtong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / longs spyod kyi bsam pas sbyin zhing de yongs su bsngo ba nyid do //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin zhing gtong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / longs spyod kyi bsam pas sbyin zhing de yongs su bsngo ba nyid do //
translated: The giving is afflicted by clinging to the view of the supremacy of bad conduct and by the thought of enjoying the fruits of giving.🔽

original: dge legs kyi lam ni rnam pa lnga ste longs spyod 'grub pa dang / bde 'gro 'grub pa dang / bde 'gro 'grub pa dang / sdug bsngal med pa 'grub pa dang / bdag gi don 'grub pa dang / sems can gyi don 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dge legs kyi lam ni rnam pa lnga ste longs spyod 'grub pa dang / bde 'gro 'grub pa dang / bde 'gro 'grub pa dang / sdug bsngal med pa 'grub pa dang / bdag gi don 'grub pa dang / sems can gyi don 'grub pa'o //
translated: The five aspects of the path of virtue are: the accomplishment of wealth, the accomplishment of good rebirth, the accomplishment of the absence of suffering, the accomplishment of one's own aim, and the accomplishment of the aims of others.

original: de la longs spyod 'grub pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod 'grub pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The accomplishment of wealth is the meritorious work of the nature of giving.

original: de la bde 'gro 'grub pa ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de la bde 'gro 'grub pa ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The accomplishment of good rebirth is the meritorious work of the nature of morality.

original: de la sdug bsngal med pa 'grub pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal med pa 'grub pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the absence of suffering is the meritorious work of the nature of meditation.🔽The accomplishment of one's own aim is the meritorious work of the nature of the three vehicles.

original: de la bdag gi don 'grub pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de la bdag gi don 'grub pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //
translated: The accomplishment of one's own aim is the path of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: de la sems can gyi don 'grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi don 'grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam mo //
translated: The accomplishment of the aims of others is the path of the bodhisattva.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'du shes lnga bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'du shes lnga bsgom par bya ste /
translated: In order to attain that, one should cultivate five notions:

original: 'dod pa rnam la mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / lus rnams la 'tsho ba ngan pa'i 'du shes dang / 'dod pa'i khams la 'jig pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / 'dus byas thams cad la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sems can thams cad las snying brtse ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnam la mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / lus rnams la 'tsho ba ngan pa'i 'du shes dang / 'dod pa'i khams la 'jig pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / 'dus byas thams cad la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sems can thams cad las snying brtse ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: the notion of impurity with regard to the body, the notion of the foulness of the body, the notion of the impermanence of all conditioned things, the notion of suffering with regard to all formations, and the notion of the selflessness of all things.

original: mar gyi nying khu lta bu'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa yin no /🔽// / bam po sum cu @281a * //🔽rtsa gnyis pa /
analyzed: mar gyi nying khu lta bu'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa yin no / // / bam po sum cu @281a * // rtsa gnyis pa /
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on the analysis of the spiritual levels.🔽This is the commentary on the chapter on the analysis of the spiritual levels.

original: ji ltar mdo'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la bab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la bab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag rab tu shes she na /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter on the spiritual levels in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In brief, it is fivefold:

original: brda dang / gzung ba dang / go rims dang / lung dang / byed pas so //
analyzed: brda dang / gzung ba dang / go rims dang / lung dang / byed pas so //
translated: by way of conventional expressions, by way of retention, by way of sequence, by way of scriptural tradition, and by way of performance.

original: ji ltar brda las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar brda las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is it by way of conventional expressions?

original: chos kyi rnam grangs gang gi ming dang / brdar gdags pa gang yin pa de dag rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs gang gi ming dang / brdar gdags pa gang yin pa de dag rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the conventional expressions and designations of the names of the various teachings.

original: ji ltar gzung ba las rab tu shes she na /🔽ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang dag gis /
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba las rab tu shes she na / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang dag gis /
translated: How is it by way of retention?

original: des chos kyi rnam grangs de dag bstan pa de dag rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: des chos kyi rnam grangs de dag bstan pa de dag rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the teachings by means of the collections of names, collections of phrases, and collections of letters.

original: ji ltar go rims las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar go rims las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is it by way of sequence?

original: chos kyi rnam grangs kyis chos kyi rnam grangs dang / tshig gis tshig gi go rims rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs kyis chos kyi rnam grangs dang / tshig gis tshig gi go rims rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the sequence of teachings by means of the sequence of teachings, and of phrases by means of the sequence of phrases.

original: ji ltar lung las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar lung las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is it by way of scriptural tradition?

original: 'di ltar chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'am /
translated: It is the knowledge that these teachings were spoken by the Tathagata,

original: nyan thos kyis bshad pa'am /🔽khyim pas bshad pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis bshad pa'am / khyim pas bshad pa'am /
translated: He knows the teaching of the disciples,🔽the teaching of the laymen,

original: rab tu byung bas bshad do zhes rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas bshad do zhes rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: and the teaching of the monks.

original: ji ltar byed pa las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byed pa las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know from the action?

original: 'di ltar chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa dang / lha dang mi rnams la phan pa'i bar gyi phyir bshad do zhes rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi rnam grangs 'di dag ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa dang / lha dang mi rnams la phan pa'i bar gyi phyir bshad do zhes rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: He knows that these Dharma teachings were explained for the benefit of self, for the benefit of others, up to for the benefit of gods and men.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis mdo'i sde yang rab tu shes la /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis mdo'i sde yang rab tu shes la /
translated: By these five aspects he knows the Sutra Pitaka,

original: gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde'i par yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde'i par yang rab tu shes so //
translated: up to he knows the Vinaya Pitaka.

original: ji ltar bshad pa de'i don rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa de'i don rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the meaning of what is explained?

original: rnam pa lnga kho nas te kun nas slong ba dang ; tshig rab tu dbye ba dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / rigs pa dang / don mdor bsdu bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga kho nas te kun nas slong ba dang ; tshig rab tu dbye ba dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / rigs pa dang / don mdor bsdu bas so //
translated: By five aspects: by the motivation, by the analysis of the words, by the connection, by the reasoning, and by the summary of the meaning.

original: ji ltar kun nas slong ba las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun nas slong ba las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know from the motivation?

original: gdul ba de dag kha cig la yang dag par bstan pa dang / de dag kha cig yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i bar gyi phyir bshad pa rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba de dag kha cig la yang dag par bstan pa dang / de dag kha cig yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i bar gyi phyir bshad pa rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the explanation in order to teach some of those to be trained, and in order to delight some of them.

original: ji ltar tshig rab tu dbye ba las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshig rab tu dbye ba las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the divisions of words?

original: rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid dang nges pa'i tshig dang rnam par dbye ba rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid dang nges pa'i tshig dang rnam par dbye ba rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the categories, the characteristics, the etymologies, and the divisions.

original: ji ltar mtshams sbyar ba las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshams sbyar ba las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the connections?

original: rnam par bshad pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / bsgrub @281b pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshams sbyar ba rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / bsgrub @281b pa'i mtshams sbyar ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshams sbyar ba rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the connections of the explanations, the connections of the proofs, and the connections of the conclusions.

original: ji ltar rigs pa las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the reasonings?

original: rigs pa bzhi po ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi po ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pas rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the four reasonings: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of proof, the reasoning of performance of function, and the reasoning of nature.

original: ji ltar don mdor bsdu ba las rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar don mdor bsdu ba las rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he know the summary of the meaning?

original: 'di ni phung po dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
translated: This is a discourse on the aggregates.

original: 'di ni khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / bden pa dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / bden pa dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
translated: This is a discourse on the elements, sense bases, dependent origination, the possible and impossible, and the truths.

original: 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nas /
translated: This is a discourse on the applications of mindfulness, etc., up to

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan pa'i bar gyi gtam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ldan pa'i bar gyi gtam mo //
translated: the noble eightfold path.

original: 'di ni las dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni las dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
translated: This is a discourse on action.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i gtam mo //
translated: This is a discourse on the afflictions.

original: 'di ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bslab pa dang ldan pa'i gtam mo zhes rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bslab pa dang ldan pa'i gtam mo zhes rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: This is a discourse on the training in superior morality, etc.

original: ji ltar dus shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dus shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he know the time?

original: rnam pa lnga kho nas te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga kho nas te /
translated: In five ways alone:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon du phyogs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas skabs rab tu rtogs pa dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa skyed pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon du phyogs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas skabs rab tu rtogs pa dang / gnyen po yid la byed pa skyed pa dang /
translated: 1. He understands the manifestation of the defilements; 2. he understands the tendency to the defilements; 3. he understands the state free from defilements; 4. he produces the mental attention of the counteractives; 5. he produces the mental attention of the absence of counteractives.

original: gnyen po yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: gnyen po yid la byed pas so //
translated: He produces the mental attention of the absence of counteractives by means of the counteractive mental attention.

original: ji ltar tshod shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshod shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he know the right measure?

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa rgyas par bya ste /
translated: He knows the right measure in eating, drinking, etc.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na spong ba dang / rjes su mthun pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na spong ba dang / rjes su mthun pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: And that in brief is to be known as twofold: 1. in the sense of avoidance and 2. in the sense of conformity.

original: nye bar ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: In the sense of avoidance and in the sense of conformity with the practice of austerity.

original: de la nye bar ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni /
analyzed: de la nye bar ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni /
translated: Therein, in the sense of avoidance is

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba'i tshod shes par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba'i tshod shes par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the right measure in eating, drinking, chewing and tasting.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'gro ba dang sdod pa la sogs pa'i tshod shes par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'gro ba dang sdod pa la sogs pa'i tshod shes par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The effort that is in accord with the practice of yoga is the knowledge of the proper amount of activity and rest.

original: de la ji ltar bza' ba la sogs pa'i tshod shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bza' ba la sogs pa'i tshod shes par byed ce na /
translated: How does one know the proper amount of eating, etc.?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: blang ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshod shes pa ste /🔽de la blang ba'i tshod shes pa ni dus gang gi tshe blang bar bya @282a * //
analyzed: blang ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshod shes pa ste / de la blang ba'i tshod shes pa ni dus gang gi tshe blang bar bya @282a * //
translated: One knows the proper amount of accepting and enjoying.

original: tshe 'di la goms pa'i tshul gyis tha mal par smra ba dang / tshig de la bslab par 'dod pas so sor rtogs pa'i stobs kyis zin pa dang / de'i tshig de lkog gam /
analyzed: tshe 'di la goms pa'i tshul gyis tha mal par smra ba dang / tshig de la bslab par 'dod pas so sor rtogs pa'i stobs kyis zin pa dang / de'i tshig de lkog gam /
translated: Or, due to habituation in this life, one speaks in a natural way.

original: mig sngar de thams cad du mi slu ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig sngar de thams cad du mi slu ba yin pa'o //
translated: One’s speech is not deceptive in any way, either in private or in public.

original: de la ji ltar mi smra bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar mi smra bar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one remain silent?

original: dus lngar te /
analyzed: dus lngar te /
translated: One remains silent in five situations.

original: gal te gtam zer ba na nyan pa po mi nyan cing gtam rlung skur ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba ston par byed na /
analyzed: gal te gtam zer ba na nyan pa po mi nyan cing gtam rlung skur ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba ston par byed na /
translated: If, when one is speaking, the listener does not listen, but speaks over one, or shows distraction,

original: de la smra ba pos mi smra bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la smra ba pos mi smra bar bya zhe na /
translated: then the speaker should remain silent.

original: gal te gtam zer ba na nyan pa po chog gi mi nyan to zhes gtam spong bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te gtam zer ba na nyan pa po chog gi mi nyan to zhes gtam spong bar byed na /
translated: If, when one is speaking, the listener rejects one’s speech, saying, “Enough! I will not listen!”

original: de la yang smra ba pos mi smra bar bya ba dang / gal te gtam zer ba na nyan pa po smra ba po la klan ka tshol ba'i sems kyis rtsod pa dang / nyes rtsom gyi tshig gis nye bar gnas na /
analyzed: de la yang smra ba pos mi smra bar bya ba dang / gal te gtam zer ba na nyan pa po smra ba po la klan ka tshol ba'i sems kyis rtsod pa dang / nyes rtsom gyi tshig gis nye bar gnas na /
translated: If the listener is looking for a chance to criticize the speaker, or if he is standing nearby with the intention of finding fault, then the speaker should remain silent.

original: de la yang smra ba pos mi smra bar bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pas mgron du bos pa na yang mi smra bas mgron du bos pa bdag gir bya ba dang / phas kyi rgol ba nye bar 'ongs te gtam zer ba na /
analyzed: de la yang smra ba pos mi smra bar bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pas mgron du bos pa na yang mi smra bas mgron du bos pa bdag gir bya ba dang / phas kyi rgol ba nye bar 'ongs te gtam zer ba na /
translated: If the listener is a patron or benefactor who has invited the speaker to accept Dharma robes, alms-food, and so on, then the speaker should accept the invitation without speaking.

original: smra ba pos gtam mjug tu ma phyin gyi bar du yang mi smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba pos gtam mjug tu ma phyin gyi bar du yang mi smra bar bya'o //
translated: If an adversary comes and asks for a discussion, the speaker should remain silent until the discussion is concluded.

original: bdag gi dad pa nas rigs kyi bu nyid ji tsam pa ni rgyu gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi dad pa nas rigs kyi bu nyid ji tsam pa ni rgyu gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The son of noble family should know that his faith is genuine if it is based on three causes:

original: gnas dang ngo bo nyid dang dus kyis so //
analyzed: gnas dang ngo bo nyid dang dus kyis so //
translated: his faith is based on the essence, on the time, and on the place.

original: de la ji ltar gnas las dad pa rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gnas las dad pa rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How is faith based on the essence?

original: dad pa'i gnas kyi dngos po gang yin pa dang / dmigs pa gang las dad pa skye ba na /🔽bdag gi dad pa ni 'di tsam mo //🔽dad @284a * //
analyzed: dad pa'i gnas kyi dngos po gang yin pa dang / dmigs pa gang las dad pa skye ba na / bdag gi dad pa ni 'di tsam mo // dad @284a * //
translated: The object of faith is that which is the basis of faith, and the object from which faith arises. 🔽One knows as it really is: My faith is just this much,

original: pa'i gnas ni 'di yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i gnas ni 'di yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: and the basis of faith is just this.

original: ji ltar ngo bo nyid las dad pa rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo bo nyid las dad pa rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How is faith to be known by its essential nature?

analyzed: dad pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: One knows as it really is: Faith is small, middling, or great.

original: ji ltar dus las dad pa rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dus las dad pa rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How is faith to be known by its time?

original: bdag gis dad pa ni dus 'di tsam nas skyes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dad pa ni dus 'di tsam nas skyes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: One knows as it really is: My faith arose at this time.

original: dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa nas /
translated: As with faith, so it is with morality, etc. up to:

original: spobs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spobs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One knows as it really is: My eloquence is just this much, and the basis of eloquence is just this.

original: de la dad pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Faith is the limb of application.

original: tshul khrims ni zhugs pa'i zhi gnas kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni zhugs pa'i zhi gnas kyi yan lag yin no //

original: thos pa ni lhag mthong gi yan lag yin no //

original: gtong ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshogs kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: gtong ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshogs kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: Generosity is the limb of the accumulation of calm abiding and insight.

original: bdag nyid kyi bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang gzhan las rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sdud pa'i yan lag yin no //

translated: Wisdom that arises from one's own thought and the instructions and teachings that are in accord with others are the limbs of the gathering of calm abiding and insight.

original: de la brten nas zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong thob pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yang thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong thob pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yang thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di nyid ni rgol ba mi mthun pa lus dang ngag gis log par bsgrub pa dag la bzod pa dang des pas bsdus pa yin no //

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rigs dman pa dang / snying rje chung ba dang / mthu med pas so //

original: 'di lta ste /

original: 'on te sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir yin /
analyzed: 'on te sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir yin /

analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyi ngo mtshar tsam bsal ba'i phyir zhes byar ni mngon par shes pa thob pa la de mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is in order to clear up their own doubts, that is not proper for those who have attained the superknowledges.

translated: If it is in order to help other beings, then it must be explained how they help other beings.

analyzed: smras pa / sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir yin te / de dag dang sems can gzhan dag la @285a * //
translated: “It is for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: phan gdags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of benefiting those hungry ghosts and other sentient beings.🔽Because by means of the power of his own superknowledge, he causes those hungry ghosts to recollect their previous lives.

original: 'di ltar des rang gi mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis yi dgas de dag gi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par byed cing des na de dag gis bdag nyid kyi sngon nyes par bya ba'i las dran nas /

analyzed: ston pa dang / skyo bar byed la chos bstan pa la yang sems gtod par byed de /
translated: and the teacher causes them to feel regret and to direct their minds to the teaching of the Dharma.

original: rgyu des myur ba myur ba kho nar yi dags kyi skye gnas las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te de ltar de ni yi dgas de dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des myur ba myur ba kho nar yi dags kyi skye gnas las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te de ltar de ni yi dgas de dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: By that cause, they are quickly liberated from the birthplace of hungry ghosts. Thus, he benefits those hungry ghosts.

original: de dag gi sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu mi 'dod pa sna tshogs bstan pa de dag thos nas /
analyzed: de dag gi sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu mi 'dod pa sna tshogs bstan pa de dag thos nas /
translated: Having heard the teaching of the various undesirable results of their previous karma,

original: nyan thos mngon par shes pa thob pa des gzhan dag kyang mos par byed cing /
analyzed: nyan thos mngon par shes pa thob pa des gzhan dag kyang mos par byed cing /
translated: the śrāvaka who has attained superknowledge causes others to be inspired and

original: gzhan dag gis kyang de de las thos nas yid skyo zhing mi dge ba spangs nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang de de las thos nas yid skyo zhing mi dge ba spangs nas /
translated: Others, having heard it from him, become disgusted and abandon evil.

original: dge ba yang dag par blang ba la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par blang ba la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: They undertake the practice of virtue.

original: de ltar de ni de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de ni de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus he benefits other sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa drug gis rags pa nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa drug gis rags pa nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The form of the desire realm should be seen as gross in six ways.

original: rags pa nyid rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rags pa nyid rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six ways of grossness?

original: mang ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / mi gtsang ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / sems kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa nyid kyis rags pa nyid do //
analyzed: mang ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / mi gtsang ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba nyid kyis rags pa nyid dang / sems kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa nyid kyis rags pa nyid do //
translated: Grossness by quantity, grossness by impurity, grossness by roughness, grossness by heaviness, grossness by change, and grossness by not following the mind.

original: nyan thos kyi sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
translated: The śrāvaka level is finished.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The remainder of the text of the ascertainment is not extant.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The text of the Bodhisattvabhumi on the subject of the stages of the pratyekabuddha is not extant.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa nyan thos kyi rigs sgrub pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang 'grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa nyan thos kyi rigs sgrub pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi on the subject of the bodhisattva should be understood in the same way as the Sravakabhumi on the subject of the sravaka.

original: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /

analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i skal ba med pa nyid dang / sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa nyid dang / de'i 'bras bu yongs su grub pa'i skal pa med pa nyid dang / sbyor ba dang de'i 'bras bu yongs su bsgrub pa'i skal pa med pa nyid dang /
translated: the absence of the fortune for purification, the absence of the fortune for practice, the absence of the fortune for the accomplishment of its result, the absence of the fortune for the practice and the accomplishment of its result,

original: phan gdags pa'i skal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i skal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: and the absence of the fortune for assistance.

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The absence of the fortune for purification is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can nyid yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, someone is by nature not destined for nirvana.

original: de la sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The absence of the fortune for practice is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can nyid yin zhing /
translated: In this case, someone is destined for nirvana,

original: sems kyi rgyud kyang yongs su smin pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud kyang yongs su smin pa yin mod kyi /
translated: but the continuum of his mind is not ripe.

original: des de'i mod la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags par gyur pas des tshe 'di la sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: des de'i mod la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags par gyur pas des tshe 'di la sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa yin pa'o //
translated: Because of that, he has no opportunity for application in this life.

original: de la de'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The lack of opportunity for the full result of that is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yin yang /
translated: In this case, someone is a person who is completely liberated,

original: sems kyi rgyud yongs su ma smin pa yin pas /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud yongs su ma smin pa yin pas /
translated: but his mental continuum is not fully ripened.

original: des yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: des yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa ma yin yang /
translated: Because of that, he has not accumulated the karma that would obscure his application.

original: des na de'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa'i skal ba med pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa'i skal ba med pa yin pa'o //
translated: Because of that, he has no opportunity for the full result of that.

original: de la sbyor ba dang de'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba dang de'i 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The lack of opportunity for application and the full result of that is as follows:🔽In this case, someone is a person whose mental continuum is completely liberated,

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la rgyud yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can nyid yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la rgyud yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can nyid yin yang /
translated: but

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: He is not fully ripened.

original: des de'i mod la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las kyang byas shing bsags pas /
analyzed: des de'i mod la yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las kyang byas shing bsags pas /
translated: He has also committed and accumulated the karma that would obstruct his correct practice at that time.

original: des gnyis ka'i skal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: des gnyis ka'i skal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not fortunate in either case.

original: de la phan gdags pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te /🔽'di ltar 'di na la las de'i mod la dbul por 'gyur ba'am /🔽phongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de la phan gdags pa'i skal ba med pa nyid ni 'di yin te / 'di ltar 'di na la las de'i mod la dbul por 'gyur ba'am / phongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The lack of fortune to be helped is as follows.🔽For example, someone has committed and accumulated the karma to experience poverty,

original: sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba ngas par myong bar 'gyur pa'i las byas shing bsags pas /🔽des na de'i tshe 'di la phyug po nyid dam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba ngas par myong bar 'gyur pa'i las byas shing bsags pas / des na de'i tshe 'di la phyug po nyid dam /
translated: destitution, and suffering at that time.🔽Therefore, he is not fortunate to be wealthy,

original: 'byor pa'am / bde bar 'gyur pa'i skal ba med pa yin no//🔽@287b skal ba yod pa nyid rnam pa lnga ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa'am / bde bar 'gyur pa'i skal ba med pa yin no// @287b skal ba yod pa nyid rnam pa lnga ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: prosperous, or happy at that time.🔽The five kinds of fortune should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: de kho na'i don rnam par shes par 'dod pas mdor bsdu na dngos po lnga rnam par shes par bya ba'i sdom ni /
analyzed: de kho na'i don rnam par shes par 'dod pas mdor bsdu na dngos po lnga rnam par shes par bya ba'i sdom ni /
translated: The five topics that one who wishes to understand the meaning of reality should know are summarized in the following verse with five points.

original: bstan dang mnyam par dbye ba dang // yod dang rdzas dang kun rdzob dang // rab tu skye dang gzhan nyid dang // mtshan nyid rnam pa gzugs can yin //🔽dngos po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan dang mnyam par dbye ba dang // yod dang rdzas dang kun rdzob dang // rab tu skye dang gzhan nyid dang // mtshan nyid rnam pa gzugs can yin // dngos po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: The five entities are:🔽The basis, the object, the sign,🔽The object of engagement, and the engagement.🔽The five entities are the basis, the object, the sign, the object of engagement, and the engagement.🔽What is the basis?

original: rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: 1. The five categories are: the sign, the name, the conceptual differentiation, reality, and correct knowing.

original: rgyu mtshan gang zhe na /🔽mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang zhe na / mdor bsdu na /
translated: What is the sign?

original: mngon par brjod pa'i tshig gi gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i tshig gi gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is that which is the basis of the expression of a name.

original: ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gang zhe na /
translated: What is a name?

original: rgyu mtshan de nyid la tshig bla dags gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de nyid la tshig bla dags gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the expression which is applied to the sign.

original: rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conceptual differentiation?

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities which occur in the three realms.

original: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na /🔽chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na / chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba /
translated: What is reality?

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
translated: It is the absence of self in things, as revealed by the knowledge of the noble ones.🔽What is correct knowing?

original: mngon par brjod pa tshig thams cad kyi gzhi'i gnas su ma gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa tshig thams cad kyi gzhi'i gnas su ma gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the basis of all verbal expressions.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right knowledge?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be regarded as twofold:

original: gcig tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: transcendental and mundane, and both transcendental and mundane.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa gcig tu 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa gcig tu 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right knowledge that is exclusively transcendental?

original: gang gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by which the disciples, the individual Buddhas, and the bodhisattvas penetrate reality.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' rnams rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' rnams rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattvas apply themselves to the five branches of knowledge,

original: de bzhin nyid shes pa thams cad du 'gro bas de la lan mang du gnas shing shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shes pa thams cad du 'gro bas de la lan mang du gnas shing shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: they abide in the knowledge of reality which is directed everywhere, and they acquire the purification of the obscurations of the knowable.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mundane and supramundane right knowledge?

original: gang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa dang pos de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs nas /
analyzed: gang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa dang pos de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs nas /
translated: The first right knowledge of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is the knowledge of reality tathata.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa dang po'i rjes las 'thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pas rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa dag la khams gsum pa las yid skrag par byed pa dang / khams gsum pa rab tu zhi ba'i ro myong bar byed cing @288a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa dang po'i rjes las 'thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pas rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa dag la khams gsum pa las yid skrag par byed pa dang / khams gsum pa rab tu zhi ba'i ro myong bar byed cing @288a * //
translated: The second right knowledge is mundane and supramundane, and is established as the knowledge that follows the first supramundane knowledge. It is the knowledge that is frightened of the three realms and the knowledge that experiences the taste of the peace of the three realms.

original: de la lan mang du gnas pa nyid kyis myur ba myur ba kho nar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lan mang du gnas pa nyid kyis myur ba myur ba kho nar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: By frequently abiding in that, one quickly attains the purification of the obscurations of affliction.

original: de yang ma 'dris pa'i don gyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang ma 'dris pa'i don gyis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin la /
translated: That is supramundane in the sense of being unfamiliar.

original: tha snyad kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i don gyis 'jig rten pa yin pas de'i phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i don gyis 'jig rten pa yin pas de'i phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is mundane because it has as its object the conventional characteristics of things. Therefore, it is called mundane and supramundane.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de las dgongs nas ngas ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa yang yod par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de las dgongs nas ngas ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa yang yod par gsungs so //
translated: The Lord, with this in mind, said: “I have said that there is mundane knowledge.

original: ngas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yang yod par gsungs so //
analyzed: ngas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yang yod par gsungs so //
translated: I have said that there is supramundane knowledge.

original: ngas ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yang yod par gsungs so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ngas ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yang yod par gsungs so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: I have said that there is knowledge that is both mundane and supramundane.”

original: de la rnam par rtog pas bsdus pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pas bsdus pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa kho na yin no //
translated: In this regard, that knowledge which is included in conceptualization is mundane.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang pos bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang pos bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na yin no //
translated: That which is included in the first right knowledge is supramundane.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa gnyis pas bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa gnyis pas bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
translated: That which is included in the second right knowledge is both mundane and supramundane.

original: rgyu mtshan yod par brjod par bya'am med par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yod par brjod par bya'am med par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should one say that it has a reason or that it does not have a reason?

original: smras pa / yod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / yod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it has a reason.

original: ci ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gdags pa las 'dogs pa ji lta ba de ltar yod par brjod par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gdags pa las 'dogs pa ji lta ba de ltar yod par brjod par bya'am zhe na /
translated: Should one say that it exists as it is designated in terms of essential nature and particular?

original: smras pa / de ltar med par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar med par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it does not exist in that way.

original: ci rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ji lta ba de ltar yod par brjod par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ji lta ba de ltar yod par brjod par bya'am zhe na /
translated: Should one say that it exists as it is the domain of conceptualization?

original: smras pa / de ltar yod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar yod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it exists in that way.

original: rgyu mtshan de ltar yod pa nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu mtshan yod par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin la med par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin /🔽yod pa dang med par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de ltar yod pa nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu mtshan yod par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin la med par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin / yod pa dang med par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in the existence of the reason in that way is skilled in answering with a reason, skilled in answering without a reason,🔽skilled in answering with a reason and without a reason,

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa yin no //
translated: and skilled in answering neither with a reason nor without a reason.

original: de ltar lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar lan 'debs pa la yang mkhas pa de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs nas /
translated: The wise one who answers in this way, having abandoned the extreme of superimposition and the extreme of denial,

original: dbu ma'i lam gyis chos kyi dbyings ston par byed do //🔽ci rgyu mtshan brjod pa'i don gyis yod par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gyis chos kyi dbyings ston par byed do // ci rgyu mtshan brjod pa'i don gyis yod par brjod par bya'am /
translated: teaches the reality of dharmas by the middle way.🔽Should one say that it exists by the meaning of verbal expression,

original: brjod du med pa'i don gyis yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i don gyis yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: or should one say that it exists by the meaning of inexpressibility?

original: smras @288b pa ;
analyzed: smras @288b pa ;
translated: It is said:

original: gnyis ka ltar yod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that it exists in both ways.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar brjod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa de ltar gnas pa brjod pa'i don gyis ni yod par brjod par bya la /
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa de ltar gnas pa brjod pa'i don gyis ni yod par brjod par bya la /
translated: One should say that it exists by the meaning of verbal expression, in that it exists as the basis of verbal expression, just as it is expressed.

original: ji ltar ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu 'dogs pa yongs su ma grub pa de ltar ni brjod du med pa'i don gyis ni med par brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu 'dogs pa yongs su ma grub pa de ltar ni brjod du med pa'i don gyis ni med par brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should say that it does not exist by the meaning of inexpressibility, in that it is not established as the nature and the particulars that are imputed, just as it is.

original: rgyu mtshan ji lta ba bzhin du ming dang rnam par rtog pa dang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa yang de bzhin du yod par brjod par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ji lta ba bzhin du ming dang rnam par rtog pa dang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa yang de bzhin du yod par brjod par bya'am zhe na /
translated: Should name, conceptualization, suchness, and right knowledge be described as existing in the same way that causal signs exist?

original: smras pa / de bzhin du yod par brjod par bya'o //🔽rgyu mtshan rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin du yod par brjod par bya'o // rgyu mtshan rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /
translated: They should be described as existing in the same way.

original: btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should causal signs be described as substantially existent or as nominally existent?

original: smras pa / 'du byed rdzas su yod pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'du byed rdzas su yod pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The signs of those formations that are substantially existent should be described as substantially existent.

original: btags pa'i yod pa rnams kyi ni btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: btags pa'i yod pa rnams kyi ni btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The signs of those that are nominally existent should be described as nominally existent.

original: rgyu mtshan yod par 'du byed gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis so ;🔽/ ming rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /🔽btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yod par 'du byed gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis so ; / ming rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am / btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Those formations that are causal signs are also of two kinds.🔽Should name be described as substantially existent or as nominally existent?

original: smras pa / btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be described as nominally existent.

original: de ni rgyu mtshan tsam la nye bar btags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: de ni rgyu mtshan tsam la nye bar btags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /
translated: Because it is merely designated in dependence on mere reasons.

original: btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should imagination be said to exist substantially or should it be said to exist as a designation?

original: smras pa / gnyi gar brjod par bya'o //🔽de bzhin nyid rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi gar brjod par bya'o // de bzhin nyid rdzas su yod par brjod par bya'am /
translated: It is said: Both should be said.

original: btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: btags pa'i yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should reality be said to exist substantially or should it be said to exist as a designation?

original: smras pa / rdzas su yod par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rdzas su yod par brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said: It should be said to exist substantially
